RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Maiden Claiming Purse 12000. FOR MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COMIDA COMIDA took the lead at the half mile pole and set a pressured pace, rounded the turn at the rail and was maintained under steady stretch handling. FESSIN UP chased outside through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the seven path and came along to take second the final yards. FIDDLERSHOTPLEASUR chased, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened inside the eighth pole. MOON WALKIN gave chase, rounded the turn in the three path and ran evenly in the lane. MIDNIGHT PASS bobbled leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the three path on the turn then flattened in the lane. PRINCESS MIA ROSE chased toward the inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane. MY BEST GIRL had a brief early lead then gave chase past the half mile pole, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little more. ESTILO AMOROSO chased inside, raced at the rail on the turn and weakened in the lane. EVERYDAYISAGIFT gave chase, rounded the turn about the six path and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Comida Comida
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,steady handling lane

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Wasabi Ventures Stables LLC & Greenspring Mares LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 59. Claiming Purse 12500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (W V A Races Not Co nsidered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LOVE TO ZOOM was bumped leaving the gate but took a quick lead and rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the three eighths pole, dueled clear at the rail at the quarter, was steadily handled through the upper stretch then coasted later yards. EX RATED rounded the first turn about the four path, started a bid nearing the three quarter pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, eased out nearing the head of the lane and dueled through the stretch for second. CEDARS BULLS EYE settled off the rail, bid leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and came along for third the final yards. M'LADY THATCHER rated close, challenged toward the three eighths pole and raced off the rail on the far turn, then flattened inside the eighth pole. BOCA BIRDIE lunged from the gate and saved ground well off the pace, bid past the three eighths pole, raced in the four path on the far turn and finished evenly to pass rivals outside. SARAH'S WARRIOR came in and made contact with Love To Zoom leaving the gate then rated close inside, picked up the chase past the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and weakened in the lane. HOVEL rounded the opening turn about the four path then saved ground on the second turn, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. SHESAHUMBLEHUSTLER was not a factor. The Stewards reviewed and dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Love To Zoom for alleged interference on the far turn, lodged by the rider of M'Lady Thatcher.

ENTRY.NAME: Sarah's Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: Boca Birdie
ENTRY.COMMENT: lunged break,well back inside,bid 3/8,4p far turn,passed rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Hovel
ENTRY.OWNER: McCormick Gloria F and O'Hara Vicki

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 14400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LASTWALKTOFREEDOM raced with the pace inside, dug in to the challenge of Meetmarysman leaving the three eighths pole, cleared that one past the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail and held on under steady handling. CURB THAT TIGER rounded the opening turn about the five path and raced well off the pace leaving the turn, picked up the chase past the half mile pole, raced in the four path of the far turn and cleared second later yards while outfinished for the win. COLONIAL ROAD rounded the opening turn about the six path, improved from the half mile pole and bid toward the three eighths, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened mid-stretch. FRANK THE BULL rounded the first turn in the four path, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and ran evenly down the lane. MEETMARYSMAN raced with the pace while alternating for the lead, dueled from the three eighths pole but dropped back past the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn in the three path and flattened in the lane. JUBAY raced off the rail on the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, bid approaching the three eighths pole, ran close in the three path on the far turn but weakened past the eighth. COOL DUDE stumbled at the break then saved ground, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened in the three and four paths of the far turn. THE LAST CASTLE was through early.

ENTRY.NAME: Lastwalktofreedom
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace inside,dug in 3/8,rail far turn,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Meetmarysman
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,dueled from 3/8,dropped back 5/16,3p far turn,flattened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 17500. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eli gibility)(Races Where Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SHENANDOAH CAT tapered inward and took over approaching the three eighths pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn and was kept alert through the lane. JUBA'S HOUSE was roughed off the heels of Shenandoah Cat approaching the seven sixteenths pole, quickly recovered stride to give chase from that point and rounded the turn about the three path, dug in from the head of the lane and got up for second under the wire. SISTER JOANN pressured the pace but steadied from the heels of Shenandoah Cat in the vicinity of the three eighths pole, gave chase past the pole, rounded the turn near the rail and was nipped from second under the wire. LUNAR PRAYER had a brief early lead then pressured the pace from the three eighths pole, raced close two deep on the turn and ran evenly to mid-stretch before flattening stride. TWO STEP SALLY ducked outward and made contact with. RISKSRHIGHPAYISLOW leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn and flattened in the lane. The latter was squeezed leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch and rounded the turn in the four and five paths and passed rivals in the lane. BALI BALIFLY chased inside, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. EMBERLY ducked in and made contact with Risksrhighpayislow leaving the gate, engaged in close early chase but faded past the five sixteenths pole. SHAKE IT GIRL gave chase, rounded the turn about the three path then drifted toward the head of the lane. The Stewards reviewed then dismissed a claim of foul against the rider of Shenandoah Cat for interference in the vicinity of the seven sixteenths pole, lodged by the rider of Juba's House.

ENTRY.NAME: Shenandoah Cat
ENTRY.COMMENT: tapered in,up near 3/8,set pressured pace,rail turn,kept alert

ENTRY.NAME: Lunar Prayer
ENTRY.COMMENT: briefly led,pressed pace,close 2d turn,flattened later yards

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 54. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, FILLIES AND MARES THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 116 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SNEAKY LYNK settled off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn and dug in for the lead later yards. JUBASLILBALLERINA stalked two deep then took the lead past the half mile pole, raced clear at the three eighths, rounded the far turn near the rail but was met, and relented in later yards. FAR MORE saved ground on the first turn, bid approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and finished evenly to close the gap. LUZIA set the early pace inside, was met past the half mile pole, dropped back at the three eighths and faded at the rail on the far turn. KNOBIESMAGICSONDE was shuffled back early and rounded the first turn off the rail, eased out into the backstretch, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the three path of the far turn. JUGSY saved ground. This race was hand timed.

ENTRY.NAME: Far More
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid near 3/8,off rail far turn,closed gap

ENTRY.NAME: Knobiesmagicsonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back early,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,3p far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Luzia
ENTRY.COMMENT: set early pace inside,met past 1/2,faded rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Sneaky Lynk
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,bid 7/16,close far turn,up late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Allowance Purse 31600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 12 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 12 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races W here Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CHROMATIC LASS tapered in and stalked from the three path the first turn, challenged past the seven sixteenths pole, took the nod two deep leaving the quarter, raced clear into the lane and held well under steady handling. LUCKY BLONDE rated close inside, bid nearing the three eighths pole and raced in range about the three path on the far turn, but relented in the duel through the final furlong. YOLO CHARLOTTE rounded the opening turn about the four path, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn then flattened in the lane. XANTHE settled off the rail on the first turn then eased out into the backstretch, bid past the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and ran evenly down the lane. MUSIC LASS rated the pace inside, dug in to the challenge of Chromatic Lass leaving the three eighths pole, was met at the rail past the quarter, continued close through the far turn but weakened approaching mid-stretch. ELIANAGRACE settled in the two and three paths on the opening turn and showed little response through the backstretch. PEARLY GHOST raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole but weakened at the rail on the far turn. NO DENYING DENIS saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Xanthe
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out 1/2,bid 7/16,3p far turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Pearly Ghost
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: Lucky Blonde
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated close inside,bid 3/8,close 3p far turn,relented lane

ENTRY.NAME: Chromatic Lass
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 3p,challenged past 7/16,nod mid turn,held well driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 87. Allowance Purse 31500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 12 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 12 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: NOBALLSTWOSTRIKES stalked from the three path, closed to the lead two deep midway on the far turn, dueled clear approaching the head of the lane and widened under steady handling. C R'S MANDATE rated close off the rail, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and cleared second inside the sixteenth pole. SPUNMAN rounded the opening turn about the four path, started a bid approaching the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the three path on the far turn and came along for third later yards. MISSIONSNINETYNINE took over and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was met into the backstretch and dueled from that point, gave up the lead at the rail midway on the turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. UNCAPTURED STORM ducked out and hit the gate and made contact with Hot Fudge Sonde at the break then saved ground well off the pace, picked up the chase approaching the three eighths pole and improved position, but was blocked at the rail on the far turn. SUBJECT TO CHANGE settled in the three and four paths, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole but flattened in the four path on the far turn. JAXJAXXORJACKS raced with the pace two deep, dueled into the backstretch but dropped back approaching the quarter pole and faded on the far turn. HOT FUDGE SONDE was bumped off stride leaving the gate then settled off the rail, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole then flattened in the five path of the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured Storm
ENTRY.COMMENT: ducked out,hit gate,bumped,saved ground,blocked rail far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Missionsninetynine
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Cefalu John
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met 1/2,dueled,caught rail mid turn,flattened

ENTRY.NAME: Jaxjaxxorjacks
ENTRY.COMMENT: with pace,dueled from 1/2,dropped back 1/4,faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Subject to Change
ENTRY.OWNER: Devane William E and King Adam

ENTRY.NAME: Spunman
ENTRY.OWNER: Boyer James A and Coleswood Farm Inc

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 73. Claiming Purse 14600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 12, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since November 12 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Rac es Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EXCALIBUR settled off the pace about the three path, started a bid from the seven sixteenths pole and raced in the four path on the far turn, surged from mid-stretch and got up in the final strides. LADDIE LIAM rounded the first turn in the three path then saved ground racing well off the pace, bid from the half mile pole, steadily improved in the five path on the far turn and dug in through the lane to take second under the wire. LIQUID LOUIE settled just off the pace about the three path, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took the nod two deep midway on the far turn, dug in under steady encouragement leaving the turn but was caught in the final strides. JACK THE RIPPER (FR) rated the pace inside, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, ceded the nod at the rail midway on the far turn, remained a factor through the upper stretch but flattened later yards. RIGHTEOUS MAN saved ground well off the pace, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and weakened in the lane. TOP HAT TREASON rated off the pace inside, showed little response through the backstretch and faded into the far turn. DR. FERBER was not a factor. DUNLUCE CAISSLE raced well off the pace in the three and four paths. SOUTHERN SAVIOUR stalked off the rail, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Top Hat Treason
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace inside,little response from 1/2,faded into far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Jack the Ripper (FR)
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 1/4,met mid turn,flattened late

ENTRY.NAME: Liquid Louie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,bid 7/16,nod mid turn,caught final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Excalibur
ENTRY.OWNER: Honoring Luke Stables and Kenworthy John C
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,bid 7/16,4p far turjn,surged from 1/16,up near wire
